channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: [UN: Nov. 7] It’s Climate-Talks Time; US Moves on Syria and Gaza & Much More
item.description: This Week @UN: The next secretary-general?; Sierra Leone toughens up; Syrian leader’s relief; feminist foreign policies suffering; US shakes up the Security Council. Plus: Gaza improvements; trapped & burned in Sudan; Hurricane Melissa; Brazil’s COP30; children killed in West Bank. Follow us on Blue Sky, Twitter (X), Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn. • Our #1 story ... Read more

item.title: COP30 opens in Amazon amid pressure on forests, finance, adaptation
item.description: As negotiators arrive in Belém, the test is no longer setting new goals but delivering on old ones — from financing forests to closing NDC gaps and defining how adaptation progress is measured.

item.title: Devex Career Hub: Navigating a tough market in the US and abroad
item.description: This week: what experts have told us about how to best navigate a challenging development job market; featured new job leads; and more.

item.title: US template for bilateral health deals bypasses WHO pandemic negotiations
item.description: Experts are raising concern around a template for bilateral agreements between the U.S. and partner governments that includes pathogen sharing and agreements on automatic approval for American products.

item.title: Mayor Mamdani for New York, for Multicultural Dignity
item.description: The New York City mayoral elections captured the world’s attention with an excitement normally reserved for the United States presidential elections. It all culminated on Tuesday night with Zohran Mamdani’s decisive victory, signaling that hope was emerging after a period of anxiety and uncertainty for the United States. Zohran Mamdani will represent and govern New […]

item.title: In Doha, conflict tests the promise of social development
item.description: At the Second World Summit on Social Development in Qatar, leaders wrestled with how war, fragility, and inequality threaten decades of progress.

item.title: Development consultancy trends for 2026
item.description: As numerous factors shift the development job landscape, Devex looks at how these will play out for consultants in 2026.

item.title: Devex Newswire: Brazil readies for COP30 spotlight amid chaos
item.description: The COP30 leaders’ summit ushers in the flagship global climate change conference with $5.5 billion pledged for the Tropical Forest Forever Facility. Plus, should vasectomies get a bigger public health push, and why is EIB sitting on €200 billion?

item.title: DR Congo hunger crisis worsening amid fighting and lack of aid funding
item.description: The crisis in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) continues to worsen amid ongoing fighting that has driven tens of thousands of people from their homes and created acute hunger, the UN World Food Programme (WFP) said on Friday.

item.title: ‘Worrying reports’ continue of abductions and disappearances in Syria
item.description: Nearly 100 people have been abducted or disappeared in Syria since January, the UN human rights office, OHCHR, said on Friday, calling for greater accountability from the authorities.

item.title: World News in Brief: Russian rights abuses in Ukraine, US a no-show for rights review, Orlando Blooms highlights Rohingya plight
item.description: Independent UN human rights investigators have heard first-hand accounts of torture, unlawful detention and the forced transfer of civilians during their first visit to Ukraine in more than a year.

item.title: In Brazil, Guterres calls for ‘fair, fast and final’ shift to clean energy
item.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres is continuing his campaign to accelerate the global switch from fossil fuels to clean energy – “the cheapest source of new electricity in nearly every country.”

item.title: Rights chief warns ‘abominable atrocities’ likely continue in Sudan’s El Fasher
item.description: Warnings of worsening humanitarian conditions in Sudan continue, despite reports of a ceasefire deal brokered by international mediators on Thursday.

item.title: Evolving engagement: How local players build on IMF governance efforts
item.description: During Devex Impact House @ WB/IMF, civil society and financial leaders gathered to examine how local players are reshaping governance reforms from within IMF programs.

item.title: America’s bipartisan peace agenda is going dark, along with US leadership
item.description: Opinion: A bipartisan law on the inclusion of women in peace and security efforts requires a report to be published, updating Congress on progress. It is now overdue, dealing a powerful blow to U.S. global leadership in the peace agenda.

item.title: After 2025’s ‘seismic’ shock, what’s next for development and aid?
item.description: For this special episode of our weekly podcast series, cohosts Raj Kumar and Robin Pomeroy sit down with experts to discuss the seismic financial shock wave that has hit the aid sector and explore the models needed to unlock private capital and sustain development progress.

item.title: As COP30 begins, new funding targets methane from oil, rice and waste
item.description: New investments aim to slash methane from fossil fuels, rice paddies and landfills — targeting the gas responsible for a third of current warming.

item.title: Opinion: A global social covenant led by local and regional governments
item.description: United Cities and Local Governments highlights how cities and regions are redefining governance and rights from the ground up, advancing a multilateralism that delivers — grounded in proximity, solidarity, and shared responsibility.

item.title: Brazil’s Biofuels Push Undermines Environmental Integrity at COP30
item.description: President Prabowo Subianto welcomed his counterpart Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva of Brazil to Jakarta recently to strengthen ties between the fast-growing economies. The timing is significant. The meeting was just weeks before Brazil hosts the COP30 climate change talks in Belém, a bustling port city at the mouth of the Amazon River. Like Brazil, […]

item.title: US Skips High-Level Presence at COP30 Climate Summit
item.description: “Has the world given up fighting climate change?” was a rhetorical question posed recently by the New York Times, perhaps with a degree of sarcasm. It might look that way, says Christiana Figueres, a founding partner of the nongovernmental organization Global Optimism, “as US president Donald Trump blusters about fossil fuel, Bill Gates prioritizes children’s […]
